Text: He's a nice guy, but it \n always seems like his \n head's in the clouds.

It sounds like both Lisa 
 and Cecie need to get 
 better at telling each 
 other how they feel.
A crack was discovered \n in the gravity engine. \n It's wearing out.

I didn't know... And 
 I'm not sure how Lisa 
 would feel if she found 
 out I knew...

Too long... We have to 
 take everything apart 
 and inspect it piece by 
 piece.
How long will \n it take to fix?
I hate to have to say \n this...
Everyone knows that's \n why she's so tough on \n Cecie.
Don't get into trouble.

But you bought some 
 trouble doin' that. 
 You'll need to lay low 
 for a while.
She blames herself for \n not warning her kid \n better about the danger.
Regarding Lei Elgona II
You know Lisa lost her \n own child to a gravity \n storm, long ago.
Seems like this city \n has its own share of \n problems...
I knew this day \n would come...

If that's the way you 
 want it... Just be 
 careful, the Garrison'll 
 have their eyes on you.

They're all taking 
 bribes! Hmph, maybe I 
 should buy presents for 
 the Garrison soldiers.
*Sigh* It's not easy \n making a livin'.
And the people who \n enforce the rules...

You need permission from 
 the government to 
 sneeze, and the Garrison 
 is always in my way.
I've still got a lot I \n want to see!
If it weren't for \n the Angry Centipede, \n we'd have nothing.
Do you hear me?

I heard a rumour some 
 girl down in Lei Elgona 
 mixed it up with the 
 Garrison Forces.
Sounds like we'll be in \n port for a while then.
Yeah, yeah. Don't get \n into trouble.

Just once I'd like 
 to give my kids a 
 square meal and send 
 'em to bed full.
You can't outrun time.

I know today's Thanks 
 Day and all, but I'm 
 just not in the mood to 
 go present shopping.
I'm glad I'm not the \n only one who thinks so!
We have to replace it. \n But that costs money \n we don't have.
Regarding Lei Elgona I
Regarding Lei Elgona II

Really? What a 
 coincidence! Boy, I hope 
 I don't run into her, 
 she sounds scary.

Hey Gravity Girl! Your 
 partner took off on one 
 of the personal 
 transports.
Hey, aren't you one of \n the new people with Sun \n Shipping?
And the rumour said she \n had a black cat. Just... \n like... yours...
Listen carefully.
Regarding Lei Elgona I

I won't say anything 
 bad, but... Just be 
 careful around Vogo, 
 okay?
Thanks for kickin' the \n Garrison out for us!
*Sigh* It's a shame Lisa \n isn't nicer to that \n girl.

He's mixed up in a lot 
 of trouble and a lot of 
 people have a bone to 
 pick with him.

Not to mention he's 
 always finding ways to 
 get out of doing real 
 work...
Lisa, something wrong?
Cecie went into town to \n pick up a gift for \n Lisa...
Maybe I'll wander around town a bit.
Don't cry fair lady, \n tears don't suit you.
Really? Y-You'll help \n little old me?
Oh come on Syd, do you \n ever stop?

Must be nice to just 
 wander around like some 
 vagabond chatting 
 women up.
See if I ever help him \n on mining duty again.
Oh, Kat! What perfect \n timing.
Huh?
Fair lady, this is the \n one I've told you about, \n the Gravity Shifter.
Really? This little girl \n is the one with the \n fancy powers?
If so, I could really \n use your help.
M-My help?
Oh yes, this poor woman \n has desperate needs.
Help us Kat, you're \n her only hope!
Oh-uh, well I don't \n think I can help with-
Kat, just between us, \n she's loaded.
Scratch her back, she'll \n scratch ours - catch my \n drift?
Why don't you \n scratch it then?
Come on Kat, this is our \n chance to earn that \n repayment.
I'd love to help, but-
Owwoww, oh the pain.
Syd!?
If only I didn't have \n this injury to deal \n with...
Alright, alright, \n I'll help.
I should start with that mansion.
Deliver the Invitations
Syd: \n Sounds like a big shindig tonight.
Rich Woman: \n Yes, I've got my hands full with so many people attending.
Syd: \n I imagine you need a lot of helpers.
Rich Woman: \n Exactly, the cooking alone will take forever...
What seems to be the \n problem?
I might be able to help, \n depending on what it is.
Where do I start?
Well, it's a long story, \n but...
I want to invite a few \n friends over for a \n cocktail party.
Oh, it'll be a grand \n party.
I've thought of a \n million things I want to \n do at it.
But my servants \n poo-pooed my \n wonderful ideas.
That's unheard of, \n they say. "That'll take \n too long", they say.
So your servants won't \n serve you?
Oh, they'll serve me. \n I'll make sure of that.
So, what's the thing \n that's so unheard of?
That's been resolved.
Now if you'd stop \n interrupting.
Sorry.
Well, my servants are \n working around the \n clock preparing.
So could I ask you to do \n a teeny, tiny favour for \n me?

Deliver these 
 invitations for the 
 party? Can't have a 
 party without people.
Right...
She should've just \n asked that in the \n beginning.
You'll find the names on \n the envelope.

Of course, there's a 
 little something in it 
 for you if you do this 
 for me.
Got it! I'll make sure \n they get their \n invitations.
Kat's great at taking \n care of things.
Uh-oh, Syd's about to \n lay it on again...
No! No! No!
Come now darling, we can \n get you a new one.
I don't wanna new one!
Uh, sorry to interrupt, \n but I have a delivery...
Oh what perfect timing!
I was just about to call \n for a servant.
Servant?
My little girl let her \n balloon fly off.
It should be caught \n somewhere around here.
What do you want me to \n do about it?
I WANT MY BALLOON!
I'm just here to make a \n delivery...
I'm too distraught to \n accept a delivery.

*Sigh* A balloon, huh? 
 If I find it for you, 
 will you take the 
 invitation then?
Are you going to make me \n ask again!?
N-No...
Is everyone around here \n like this...?
Head to the Next Mansion
Maybe I can use the water from that pond.
Water the Plants
That's the last of 'em, better let the owner know I'm done.
One more to go, hope the next person is somewhat normal.
Head to the Next Mansion
Found it! Better get it back to that little girl.
My balloon!
Isn't that nice darling?
I'm glad she's so happy, \n that must be one special \n balloon.
Of course it is. I only \n play with the best.
It's filled with gravity \n gas to make it fly \n faster and farther.
My Daddy has \n connections!
I'm the only one in Lei \n Havina with one!
Connections and cash \n seem to make this world \n go around...
Oh, I almost forgot, \n here's your delivery.
An invitation? I wonder \n what kind of party it'll \n be this time.
Parties are great, I'd \n love to join-
Servants don't "join" \n parties, stupid.
Look, I am NOT a \n servant!
Then why are you here? \n You look so poor!
Lei Havina is for rich \n people like us. You \n don't belong here.

Exactly, darling. I've 
 raised such a 
 wonderfully 
 discriminating girl.
Like mother, \n like daughter...
Find the Missing Balloon
Guess I'd better start looking around this island.
Nope, nothing here.
If it flew away, it must be someplace high.
Maybe it's behind the mansion.
Hmm, is that what I think it is?
Phew, all done delivering the invitations. Better get back.
Hello I've got-
Can you believe this!? \n My babies are sick.
Your babies? \n Where are they?
Oh look at them, wilting \n in the garden.
O-Oh, THOSE babies... \n You have a lovely \n garden.
Less talking, more \n watering!
It's your garden, why \n don't you water them?
Hop to it! I've got my \n eye on you.
Better just get it over \n with...
It's impossible \n reasoning with \n these people...
I need to find that kid's balloon.
Nothing left to do but head to the next mansion...
Rich Woman: \n Hey now! Don't forget to water my other babies!
Yeah, yeah, I'm on it.
I finished watering your \n stupid plants...
Here's your delivery!
Oh my, an invitation to \n a party!
I see, you weren't my \n servant, you were \n someone else's.
I'm nobody's servant!
Decisions, decisions, \n what should I wear?
She's back in \n her own world...
Well, I did what I came \n here to do, goodbye!
Rich Woman: \n Pick it up! My darlings are getting thirsty.
I'm guessing these plants are her only friends...
Find the Master of the House
Guess I'd better check this place top-to-bottom.
Where could he be hiding...?
This is killing me. \n Where did he go \n this time?
Excuse me, are you the \n owner here?
You! Have you seen the \n master of the house?
Master of the house? \n I don't know who \n you're talking about...
How simple can I make \n it: The master of this \n house!
We're in the middle \n of another game of \n hide-and-seek.

And if I don't find him, 
 he'll get upset and take 
 it out on me and the 
 other servants.
Don't want that, need \n help finding him?

I need to find him 
 anyway if I want to 
 deliver the 
 invitation...
That would be great! \n He should be around \n here somewhere...
He chooses the \n strangest places to \n hide though.
Don't worry, I'll find \n him!
His servant mentioned he likes strange hiding spots...
Maybe he's near the top of the island somewhere.
Huh? What's an airboat doing parked here?
Wait! Is that-?
I need to check around that island...
Hm?
That might be the owner over there. Better go find out.
Hm?
That could be the owner, but there's only one way to find out.
Nobody's home...
Found you! You must be \n the guy who's hiding all \n the time.
Hm? I don't recognise \n you. Are you a new \n servant?
No! I'm just here to \n make a delivery.
An invitation, eh... \n Wonder what kind of \n party she has planned.
If you don't mind me \n asking, why do you keep \n playing hide-and-seek?
You're stressing out \n your servants.
They were stressed \n out... Really? That's \n wonderful!
Wh-What!?
I grew bored of all the \n other games.
Now my favourite game is \n causing people stress.
That doesn't sound like \n much fun for anyone \n else.
Maybe I should look around the island.
Rich Woman: \n Wh-What are you doing?
Remaining
Maybe he's below the island? How would he even get down there?
I'm back, and I \n delivered all of your \n invitations.
Wonderful, next you can \n fetch me some fuel from \n the market.
They'll be in crates \n like those over there.
Next!? You never \n mentioned a "next"!
Oh, now you sound just \n like my servants...
And here I was planning \n on giving you a big \n reward...
O-Oh, well, just so \n we're clear, this is the \n last job, right?
I'm in this too deep \n to stop now...
Thank you Kat, you're a \n dear!
I'm here to collect the \n fuel delivery.
Oh, you're one of the \n madam's servants?
The fuel's in that box \n there. Take it, she \n paid in advance.
What do those people in \n Lei Havina need with all \n that fuel, anyway?
They're monopolising \n sales, I can barely even \n keep up with demand.
They're probably not \n very eco-conscious...

The people down in the 
 houseboat fleet barely 
 have enough to warm 
 their water.
Well, if you feel so bad \n for them...
Couldn't you set aside \n some of your supply?
And risk losing my \n business!?
Sorry, in this town, \n money talks.
Hmm, this town's \n problem runs deep...
Am I a part of the \n problem too?

After all, if I deliver 
 this fuel to that woman, 
 I'm no better than the 
 merchant...
There must be someone \n who can use this more \n than her.
Meow!

We're changing course, 
 Dusty! We'll drop this 
 off with the Angry 
 Centipede in Lei Elgona.
It's the gravity woman!
I have some business \n with the Angry \n Centipede.
Do you have anything to \n eat? I'm so hungry...
Sorry, there's no food \n in here...
Poor little guy, the \n kids never get enough \n food down here...
What's going on?
I uh, heard fuel was \n hard to come by down \n here...
Hard to come by, more \n like "impossible to come \n by".

I'd love to feed my 
 shivering kids some warm 
 soup for a change, but 
 we can't make the heat.
The price of fuel is \n ridiculous.
Don't worry, I'll help \n you with your fuel \n problem.

Hey, can you do me a 
 favour and see that this 
 gets to everyone down 
 here?
Is... Is that fuel!? \n How'd you get so much of \n it!?

Only the people up in 
 Lei Havina have the kind 
 of cash to buy this 
 much.
I got it while helping \n out a woman up there.
She can consider it a \n down payment on my \n services...

Thanks! You don't know 
 how much this means to 
 us. I'll see it gets to 
 the people.
I'm so bored... Isn't \n there anything new and \n exciting to do?

I'm even tired of 
 burning fuel all night 
 to light my wild 
 parties.
That's what she's \n been doing with \n all this fuel!?
Madam, there are plans \n for a new amusement \n park facility.

Really? That's wonderful 
 news. But I don't recall 
 us having the real 
 estate for that up here.

Oh, it'll be down in Lei 
 Elgona, they have an 
 island that's just the 
 right size for it.
So that's where we're \n gonna build it.
Wait, what about \n the people living \n there now!?

Sounds fabulous! See to 
 it the park gets 
 constructed as soon as 
 possible.
Of course, I gave the \n order to my troops just \n now.
We'll clean out the \n island and prepare for \n construction right away.
Are you serious!?
Huh!? Wait, you're that \n girl from...
Oops...
Soldiers, to arms! We've \n caught the Shifter!
Lisa, listen, something \n bad's going down.
What is it now!?

The garrison is moving 
 troops to Lei Elgona to 
 throw out the people and 
 steal their island.
All just to build some \n stupid amusement park!
I see.
I see, that's all you \n have to say!?
The strong will always \n take from the weak. \n That's life.
If we side with the \n people in Lei Elgona, \n we'll be next.
But where will they go!?
Can't you see we don't \n have the resources to \n help anyone!?
Forget it then, I'll go \n by myself!
Wait!
I have to do something \n before this place burns \n down!
I need a way to put out \n those fires.
But how...
How long are you gonna \n keep this up!?
As long as it takes!
Captain, should we \n request extra \n assistance?
Yes, I think it's time \n to call in our \n special weapon...
Come on, know when \n you're beat and go home!
Come, Night Gale!
Raven?
Raven!
Ugh!
Yeah!
Go Night \n Gale!
Oh...
But with a little more time... \n What? No... I understand.
Orders from the top! \n We're done here.
Return to HQ \n on the double!
Th-They're \n just leaving?
We're saved!
It's just a mild \n concussion...
The way the Angry \n Centipede were acting, I \n thought we lost you.
That's what you get \n for trying to be a hero.
It can get \n you killed.
Raven... \n Why...?
What? \n Did you say \n Raven?
And so I was reunited with Raven after we had both been \n pulled into that strange gravity storm so long ago. \n Unfortunately, our reunion didn't go as well as I would've expected...
I barely recognised Raven, wearing that strange iron mask, \n and I had no idea why she would want to hurt me.
Rich Woman: \n Just drop the fuel off over there when you've got it.
Collect the Fuel \n from the Market
What does she want with all this fuel? \n Oh well, guess I better get going...
Deliver the Fuel to the \n Rich Woman's Mansion
I feel terrible helping her hoard all this fuel.
She'll understand once I explain it to her...
Huh, where'd she go?
I heard someone. Is that her?
I need to bring the fuel.
She did ask me to do this for her, so maybe I should deliver it.
No, I can't just let her hoard it.
This looks like the way to the Centipede's hideout.
But maybe I should deliver it to her, it is her money after all.
Rich Woman: \n Wh-What are you doing?
Rich Woman: \n Wh-Where are you taking that!?
Deliver the Fuel to the Woman \n or the Angry Centipede
Oh no!
Garrison forces... Do they know about the fuel?
Soldiers!? Did they find out I'm here!?
I need to warn Lisa about this!
Report to Lisa
I need to hurry and tell Lisa about what's happening.
With Banga's help, we might be able to save the houseboat fleet.
I can't believe how callous that woman was.
What are the people in Havina thinking!?
Hurry to the Houseboat Fleet
What's wrong with Lisa!? It's up to me to protect the fleet.
That's a Garrison boat! I need to head it off!
How could they do this!?
I've got to save the people in Elgona!
Extinguish the Fires \n on Lei Elgona
More fires! I need to take down the soldiers.
Now I just need to throw this into the flames...
That did it! I just have to keep it up.
That takes care of the fires, now for the soldiers.
The place is still on fire, I can't let it burn!
More of them?
There's some water, I could use that to put out the fire.
I need to help the people in Elgona!
Damage to Elgona
Garrison Forces
Defeat the Remaining Soldiers
Fires
I'm too late...
They're not giving up!
Not this way...
Why am I not surprised \n he's not well liked...

It's the one time in the 
 year when we give thanks 
 to those who mean a lot 
 to us.
If you go stirring \n anything up, we'll get \n dragged into it.
Okay, I'll be careful!
Hey, you know today's a \n special day: Thanks Day.

The ore I dropped 
 off didn't seem to 
 make much of a dent 
 in the problem...
Why does Lisa always \n have to worry so much?
